modName: Tatsumaru from Tenchu series with Voice Pack (Ninja-Assassin-Thief)
descriptionHtml:
[size=4][color=#00ff00]Hello Tenchu fans ! The character is made based on images and movies from Tenchu 3, Tenchu 2. Same goes with the sounds remastered and cleared with Audacity. I didn't rip the assets so it's my authorial work.Â 
The clothes are based on Sub-Zero with significantly remodeled mesh.

It really shines with the mods and voicepack shown in this video:[/color]

[youtube]C7r0A4QsHsI[/youtube][/size]
[size=4]You can also check Rikimaru and Ayame Mod on my profile

I highly reccomend to use following mods:[/size]

- Ponytail Hairstyles v3_0 by Azar
- Pull Mastery Hookshot or Grappling hook by Xzax
- Dragon Ninjatos by AlexScorpion
- Martial Arts by evanoblivion
- 1H and 2H katana attack animations by mofu

All mods are available on Skirim Nexus


[color=#ff7700][size=4]WHAT THE DOWNLOADED FILES CONTAIN ?[/size][/color]

- Tatsumaru's Armor, Gloves, Boots, Sword (decoration), Mask for Male Imperial (on the video), Male Nord, Male Redguard, Male Breton
- Voice pack - replaces player's Male Imperial (on the video), Male Nord, Male Redguard, Male Breton voices. Jump sound is used by everybody.
The is no way to differenciate the races with the sound files in this case.
There is a chance some NPC in game will use this voice pack but I didn't find any yet so don't worry. Jump sound uses
different pitch range depending on surface you walk on. Sounds preety weird on snow. I'm not sure how to change it.
Anything else works perfect and gives the character Tatsumaru's personality. Enjoy !

[color=#ff7700][size=4]INSTALL:[/size][/color]

1. Put and merge "Data" folder in your Skyrim directory>2. To obtain the items in the game open console command "~"
3. type: help "tatsumaru" 0 (you will see all the items related to tatsumaru)
4. type: player.additem <id number of chosen item> 1
5. Put on added items from your inventory
6. Play
[color=#ff7700][size=4]
UNINSTALL: [/size][/color]

1. Delete the files from the "Data" folder. They don't overwrite original Skyrim files so it's safe to do it.


Created by Bleeiz from Nexus Skyrim
author: Bleeiz
